cells.m_text_in:
@echo off
rem build script for the project
rem [button: Debug]
rem set LANG=zh_CN.utf8
jc --readable_c_code zmain.jc --run

# TODO LIST
lightweight graph-based editing
	opening sync - the graph is the secondary level
	inline @in: we won't use code references twice
	rework the var system to be more convenient
		just replace names like __VAR_A with unique instances, within the same node
	"file update" node
		ignore non-tagged regions in the output file, only update the tagged parts
	could use the notebook system to manage code nodes in a graph
	lightweight ops
		*add* a node to a program
			inline in-port
		convert git diff to a node
	as a way of organizing build steps and semantic code piece grouping
		meta-makefile + patch management
		patch: collection of code blocks and their placements
			persistent bookmarks
			generate from git diff / global search / manual marking
	core op: code block tag
		tag a range of code with a name
		the ranges can nest
			they can serve as both out and in ports
		nested ranges are displayed as graph edges
		there is no sync: the tags merely serve as visualization / locating aid
		tags are organized using external files
			just cite them in literate-programming-like documents
		tagged code can be easily moved around
			e.g. from an example to real production code
			dup a document, then reconnect
		organize the documents as files
			they could be just implemented as files
			and have the references rendered as views to the actual code
	--
	implementation
		ctrl+b: create code block and copy block name
		md file hook:
			when a line refers to a block, show a view into it
peek definition
	render an overlay of that editorwindow around the id in question
	do it VS-style: y translation overlay
	could be related to the graph thing
multi-example auto-edit
	the graph merge algorithm can't be applied to our DP approach

test dismantling on a copy of the main project
	build/strata.jc
	--
	pull out / pull to / pull out to
sometimes we're just using it as an organizing tool
	rework qpad hotkeys
		pull selection out to a node, then create an input port to connect it
		right-click menu
	we should not care about node file names
applying to existing projects
- (test) choose-able build output dir
- "dismantling aid" in qpad
- the qiniu project?
- the btc trader trainer?
	
redirected run for debugging
	use existing build / run systems... notebook

apply it to something
	try-hard downloader
	custom IME for phone qpad
dedicated preview nodes
	preview output for zjs script
		md / qpad rendering functions
	or invoke some external application
	only those needing editing UIs should be inside
	---
	better run the thing in the final system
(test) @out format=var
UI overhaul
	area labels
	put nodes on top of edges
	package updating UI
		package-groups: original caption
		show package dependency as nodes
		could also un-depending packages
node y ordering:
	only set rebuild flag when ordering actually changes
	use edge y to account for dots
	when build-ungrouping, scale down inner node y values
	--
	use top-bottom execution flow
make newly-created code snippets connect to all dangling in-ports on selected nodes
default interface layout: put the code editor window somewhere more convenient
drag-node-to-edge
git merging:
	https://github.com/dominictarr/xdiff
re-purpose the graph editor for shader editor?
	preview-only node class

@echo off
rem build script for 'c:/tp/qpad/qpad.jc'
rem [button: Release]
cd /d c:/tp/qpad
jc -brelease -awin64 c:/tp/qpad/qpad.jc
jc -brelease -awin32 c:/tp/qpad/qpad.jc
cd bin\win32_release
del qpad3beta_32.7z
7z a qpad3beta_32.7z qpad.exe
cd /d c:\tp\qpad
cd bin\win64_release
del qpad3beta_64.7z
7z a qpad3beta_64.7z qpad.exe
del c:\software\cmder\bin\qpad_old.exe
ren c:\software\cmder\bin\qpad.exe qpad_old.exe
copy qpad.exe c:\software\cmder\bin\qpad.exe

s7res.c

cells.m_text_in:
#!/bin/sh
#[button: Translate]
cd /c/tp/qpad/res
grep -ERoh text:\(\([\"][^\"]+[\"]\)\|\([\'][^\']+[\']\)\) * > ../build/translation.txt
grep -ERoh UI\._\\\(\(\([\"][^\"]+[\"]\)\|\([\'][^\']+[\']\)\)\\\) * >> ../build/translation.txt
grep -ERoh UI\.Format\\\(\(\([\"][^\"]+[\"]\)\|\([\'][^\']+[\']\)\), * >> ../build/translation.txt
grep -ERoh tooltip:\(\([\"][^\"]+[\"]\)\|\([\'][^\']+[\']\)\) * >> ../build/translation.txt
grep -ERoh ,name:\(\([\"][^\"]+[\"]\)\|\([\'][^\']+[\']\)\) * >> ../build/translation.txt
